body_html:
I think you're right. Please see #7907 in response to this. I'd like to kindly ask you to rerun your benchmarks on the referenced pull request.

I suspect this is a bad interaction of OpenMP and tbb, as you mentioned. I will look into that as part of a deeper investigation for this performance regression.

EDIT: If you may, this PR removes tanh #7909 only, which appears to remove the perf bug for LSTM.py on my end. Could you also give this a try?

I suspect this is a bad interaction of OpenMP and tbb, as you mentioned. I will look into that as part of a deeper investigation for this performance regression.
EDIT: If you may, this PR removes tanh #7909 only, which appears to remove the perf bug for LSTM.py on my end. Could you also give this a try?
body:
I think you're right. Please see https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/pull/7907 in response to this. I'd like to kindly ask you to rerun your benchmarks on the referenced pull request.

I suspect this is a bad interaction of [OpenMP and tbb](https://software.intel.com/en-us/node/684811), as you mentioned. I will look into that as part of a deeper investigation for this performance regression.

EDIT: If you may, this PR removes tanh https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/pull/7909 only, which appears to remove the perf bug for LSTM.py on my end. Could you also give this a try?
